noun.description: The fact or state of being plural.
examples: some languages add an extra syllable to mark plurality

noun.description: The number of votes cast for a candidate who receives more than any other but does not receive an absolute majority.
examples: his winning plurality came from creating a reform coalition

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French pluralite, from late Latin pluralitas, from Latin pluralis relating to more than one (see plural).
